Hey Arjen this is for you :-)

Hey Arjen, I noticed that all of your Ayreon albums have a lot of folky elements in it. If you're ever looking for new musicians/ instruments in that genre you should consider using one of these guys. Some bands are so unique that you cannot find any other band like it. I think Ayreon and Altan Urag both fit that description very well. Well truth be told: all good things start with an A.

Anyway I'm looking forward to your next Ayreon album. Do you think you can finish it before december so that I can ask it as a christmas present (of red je het al voor pakjesavond)?

Vriendelijke groet vanuit het vlakke Flevoland. Temuujin - Altan Urag Temuujin From Blood album

Paul Glandorf guests on 'Waves of Destruction'!

Paul Glandorf recorded lead & backing vocals on 'Waves of Destruction' as can be seen in the third album teaser. Check it out! -> https://youtu.be/w6JuOGWPgGI

Paul is known as singer in the live band of Arjen Anthony Lucassen of Ayreon (2012), as frontman of Semistereo and of A Day's Work. He has a beautiful voice with a unique and instantly recognizable sound.

Paul recorded great vocals on the track A Life Less Ordinary. Moreover, Paul's vocal style blends beautifully with Damian Wilson's. This enabled Paul to deliver some great backing vocals supporting Damian’s voice on two tracks.

"01011001" is the seventh studio album by Arjen Anthony Lucassen's long-running Ayreon project. "01011001" is the binary representation of the ASCII value of the letter Y.

Seventeen singers in total (including Lucassen himself) contributed to the album, more than any other Ayreon album. Of these, except Lucassen, only Anneke Van Giersbergen (ex- theGathering) and Floor Jansen (After Forever and Nightwish) have sung on previous Ayreon albums: Van Giersbergen on Into the Electric Castle, Jansen on The Dream Sequencer.

It also stars, among others, Bob Catley from Magnum, Hansi Kürsch from Blind Guardian, Jorn Lande, Jonas Renkse  and Steve Lee from Gotthard  in his final guest appearance before his death in 2010. The album was a commercial and critical success.

From "01011001", we bring for you today "We are forever", an amazing song with two beautiful voices: Anneke Van Giersbergen and Jonas Renkse.

~ Racing heart

As most of you will know by now, Hail of Bullets are taking a well-deserved break this year, but that doesn't mean we're taking a break from music in general. Apart from both Asphyx (Paul, Martin) and Thanatos (Stephan, Paul) doing live shows all over Europe this year, Ed will be busy with The Gentle Storm (a project featuring Anneke Van Giersbergen and Arjan Ayreon Lucassen)...

Happy 2015 all! Here are the definite tour dates for The Gentle Storm acoustic tour. So... just Anneke Van Giersbergen, me and a guitar! This may be the only chance to see this (already nervous!) recluse perform live, hope to see you there :-) Timeline Photos

I’m very proud to present you the front cover of our upcoming The Gentle Storm album with Anneke van Giersbergen! The album title is “The Diary” and the image was made by the very talented Alexandra V Bach. More about the concept soon! Timeline Photos

I recorded double bass for the very first time in my life with the excellent Hinse Mutter for the new album with Anneke van Giersbergen. What a huge monster sound, can’t believe I didn’t do this years ago! Photos from Ayreon's post
We recorded cello for the new album with Anneke van Giersbergen, more than ever this time! And as always Maaike delivered the goods :-) Timeline Photos

Arjen Anthony Lucassen (Ayreon) a révélé son nouveau projet, une collaboration avec Anneke Van Giersbergen. Plus de détails dans les news... Arjen Anthony Lucassen écrit un album avec Anneke Van Giersbergen Arjen Anthony Lucassen, plus connu pour ses projets de metal opera AYREON et STAR ONE a annoncé travailler sur un nouvel album avec la chanteuse Anneke Van Giersbergen.

Time has come to finally disclose my new project... it will be a collaboration between my favorite female singer Anneke van Giersbergen and me! Expect an epic concept double album, a combination of ‘classical meets metal’ and ‘acoustic folk’. More details later! Timeline Photos

We recorded the Epic Rock Choir (who will perform at the Human Equation theater shows) for the The Gentle Storm album, it was AMAZING! Thanks again all of you, till next time :-) Photos from Ayreon's post

We recorded bass guitar with Johan van Stratum for The Gentle Storm album. Old Stream of Passion times revisited, and Johan got even better! We recorded all his parts in just one afternoon. And of course it wouldn't be complete without the usual batch of silly childish pictures :-) Photos from Ayreon's post

We’ve been recording piano for The Gentle Storm with Joost van den Broek. Once more this true virtuoso impressed the hell out of me! And yes, we managed to make even more childish pictures than ever... and somehow they are getting more violent too, ha ha! But don’t worry, we still like each other :-) Photos from Ayreon's post

Due to unforeseen problems we re-recorded the drums for the new project with Anneke in Sandlane Studios. Ed recorded the whole album brilliantly in one day with time to spare, it’s AMAZING! Johan (who will play bass on this album) and Marcela came by too, so we had a little Stream of Passion reunion :-) Photos from Ayreon's post
Great photo shoot for the new project with Anneke! We were supposed to be serious because of the album concept, but I guess it wasn't in the cards :-) Photos from Ayreon's post

We recorded percussion with Rob Snijders, who as you may know played drums on Ayreon’s The Dream Sequencer and my solo album. What a groove and creativity, great job! Here are some silly pics again, and we even managed to shoot a not-so-silly one believe it or not! Photos from Ayreon's post

I’ve been recording violin for a couple of days with Ben Mathot, and as always he did an AMAZING job! The guy is a one man orchestra :-) Here are some ridiculously childish pictures again! Photos from Ayreon's post

Today it's about the Ayreon story timeline that's right the whole thing.
I think you can see the genius of storytelling by Arjen Anthony Lucassen here.
The timeline of the Ayreon universe spans many billions of years.
Pre-big bang Chaos.                                                             The primoridal condition before the creation of the known universe, where all matter, energy and time exist as one. (Chaos) 
Billions of years ago
14 billion BC The Big Bang.
The first soul, the Universal Migrator is born. It subsequently divides into inumerable individual entities that roam the universe, breathing life among planetary systems. (Dawn of a Million Souls) 
8 billion BC The Flight of the Migrator. 
One of the migrators traverses space and time in search of an uninhabited planet (Earth) to breathe life into, as virtually experienced later by the Mars Colonist in the Dream Sequencer.
6 billion BC The Age of Shadows.
The Age of Shadows begins on the planet Y. The Forever race's dependence on technology finally renders them slaves to their machines. After this transition, they are granted immortality through science but in the process forget the essence of their being, losing even the ability to feel emotion. (Age of Shadows/We Are Forever) 
5 billion BC M 31. 
In the Andromeda Galaxy, a migrator passes Y without effect noticing it is already inhabited by the Forever. (Out of the White Hole). Forever seed a passing comet with their own DNA and divert it to follow in the trail of the migrator in an effort to revitalize their race. (Newborn Race, Ride the Comet). 
4 billion BC The Tree of Life. 
The Migrator reaches Earth and breathes life onto the planet. (To the Solar System). 
Millions of years ago
65 million BC The Fifth Extinction.
The fifth extinction is caused when the Forever's comet collides with Earth. The cataclysm wipes out the dinosaurs which the Forever determine to be a "lower form of intelligence". The seed the Forever planted on Earth now waits dormant for the right conditions to flourish. (The Fifth Extinction) 
Thousands of years ago
50,000 BC The Stone Age. 
The first Humans stand erect. (The First Man on Earth).
The dormant Forever DNA blends with the Human gene pool resulting in accelerated mental and cultural development. (Waking Dreams). 
6th century
AD 584 The Dark Ages.
Ayreon recieves visions from the year 2084 sent back in time in an effort to change humanity's future. Blind all his life and suddenly able to see nothing but horror, Ayreon sets out on his quest to King Arthur's court to sing the visions to the most powerful man on Earth. (The Final Experiment: "Prologue", "The Dawning", "King Arthur's Court", "Visual Echoes").
Merlin overcome by jealousy of the true prophet's powers, deems him evil and untrustworthy and kills him using his magic. (The Final Experiment: "Merlin's Will and Ayreon's Fate")
Ayreon, though physically dead, his spirit is now set free to roam the universe and find his new home. (Carried by the Wind) 
8th century
A Mayan girl observes the Jaguar Temple in Tikal in Central America. (Temple of the Cat) 
16th century
Queen Elizabeth I of England gives a speech to her troops at Tilbury in preparation for an attack by the Spanish. The English fleet subsequently wins under the command of Sir Francis Drake. The speech is witnessed through the eyes of the queen by the Colonist. (Dragon on the Sea). 
20th century
AD 1900 Unnatural Selection.
The Forever accelerate Human development further, bringing about innovations in science and medicine. (Unnatural Selection). 
AD 1969 The First Moon Landing.
Mr. Lucassen, a pre-incarnation of the Colonist, watches the first Moon landing. (One Small Step) 
AD 1990 The Computer Age.
Forever intervenes with natural human development to accelerate progress in computer science and technology. (Computer Reign, Web of Lies, Connect the Dots).
AD 1995 Merlin's Prophecy.
Mr. Lucassen releases his CD The Final Experiment, thus fulfilling Merlin's prohpecy and commuicating Ayreon's cautionary visions to a new age. The results of the Final Experiment are thus placed in the hands of contemporary society.
AD 1998 The Electric Castle Experiment.
Having lost their own emotions aeons ago, the Forever race conducts experiments with human emotions. (Computer Eyes?)
21st century
AD 2007 Mr. L's Visions.
Mr. L undergoes psychiatric treatment for his visions of Humanity's decline. (The Truth is in Here). 
AD 2012
The most likely start date (in some capacity) for the War of 2084.
AD 2082 The Mars Colonist.
The Colonist is born on Mars. (My House on Mars, Back on Planet Earth). 
AD 2084 April 3rd The Time Telapathy Experiment.
As the War of 2084 reaches its climax, scientists, in one last desperate attempt to save mankind, commence the final experiment, sending visions of Humanity's future back in time to be picked up by Humans of the past. Unfortunately the experiment is a failure, managing to change online a single line of history. The war reaches its conclusion, destroying virtually all life on Earth. (Prologue, E=mc 2, 2084). 
AD 2084 November 15th The Sixth Extinction.
The year of the final war on Earth in which mankind exterminates itself in a nuclear apocalypse. (Waracle, 2084, The Sixth Extinction.)
AD 2085 Post Apocalypse.
All humans having vanished from Earth in the year after the war, Forever now focuses on the Mars Colony's last surviving humans. (2085, To the planet of Red).
22nd century
AD 2092 The Human Equation Program.
In one of many experiments to learn more about human emotions, Forever plays the Human Equation program in the Mars Colony's Dream Sequencer.
AD 2112 The Universal Migrator Program.
The Mars Colonist plays the Universal Migrator program in the Dream Sequencer and virtually preincarnates to his past lives throughout the ages.
AD 2112 And Beyond The New Migrator.
Upon the Mars Colonist's death, his soul is transformed into the New Migrator. He makes for Planet Y on a quest to revitalize the comatose Forever race by ending their dependence on machines and technology and rekindling their capacity for emotion. (New Migrator, Spirit on the Wind, Complete the Circle, The Memory Remains).

Today I will write about TV Tropes that is a wiki catalog of the tricks of the trade for writing fiction.
Tropes are devices and conventions that a writer can reasonably rely on as being present in the audience members' minds and expectations.
Let's see if TV Tropes's got anything about Ayreon?
Yes they have a lot, they also have an article about Progressive Rock.
Here are a few examples
Anyone Can Die: The Electric Castle. "Indeed, some may die."
Cloud Cuckoo Lander: The Hippie
Disappeared Dad: Me's father in The Human Equation; the Colonist's father in Universal Migrator 
Epic Rocking
Fish People: the Forevers 
Functional Magic: Merlin, the Stonehenge druids.
Ghost in the Machine: "Me" in The Human Equation.
Ham-to-Ham Combat: Frequently. But for a particularly awesome example, check out the four-way melee between Tom Eglund, Steve Lee, Daniel Gildenlow and Jorn Lande starting at 3:00 in The Fifth Extinction.                                                                    Mike Baker vs. Devin Townsend in "Day Sixteen: Loser"
Heavy Mithril: They're sci-fi/fantasy.
Humans Are the Real Monsters: We gave them dreams, and what did they dream?
I Just Want to Be Normal: Ayreon in the song "Nature's Dance". It's understandable.
It's All About Me: The barbarian oh so very much.
Mind Screw: Pretty much everything.
Neoclassical Punk Zydeco Rockabilly: Folk progressive rock pop neoclassical metal.
Progressive Metal
Rock Opera
Running Gag: the many ways Arjen has come up with not to thank his brother.
13 days to The Theory of Everything

Well, that was easy... of course it’s the one and only Sir Russell Allen completing the cast! And once again he proves he’s up there with the best. The winner is Foteini Elric, please send me a personal message here. One more musician to guess after this, you can listen to the guest musicians so far here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

Yes of course.... this is indeed the insurmountable Tommy Karevik of Kamelot and Seventh Wonder... amazing, huh? He already brought me to tears on Theory of Everything, but this really exceeds my wildest expectations, he’s definitely showing his full potential here! The winner is Kaitlin Kino, please send me a personal message here. You can listen to the guest musicians so far here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

Wait for it... this is actually the amazing Marcel Coenen! He already proved to me how good he is with the Theater Equation, but this solo is beyond good... He recorded this last week right before my eyes in my studio, otherwise I would have never believed it! The winner is Stefan Kessels, please send me a personal message here. Stay tuned for more, and listen to the guest musicians so far here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Marcel Coenen Marcel Coenen Timeline Photos

Absolutely, this is of course Zaher Zorgati from the great Tunisian band Myrath. I’ve enjoyed Myrath for years, so I’m glad to have Zaher on my album. I’m sorry to say it’s just a small part this time, but the future is wide open! The winner is Julian Hahn, please send me a personal message here. Stay tuned for more, and listen to the guest musicians so far here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

Yes indeed... it’s the great Mark Kelly from the mighty Marillion! I really love the wonderful melodies and the dreamy sound, I’m honored to have Mark on the album! The winner is Terje Tiberius Mork, please send me a personal message here. Stay tuned for more next week, and listen to the guest musicians so far here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

Oh yes indeed, it’s Nils K. Rue from the fantastic Norwegian band Pagan’s Mind! I’ve been wanting to work with Nils for years, I’m glad it finally happened. Great job, Nils! The winner is Denisa Varcholova, please send me a personal message here. Stay tuned for more in a few days, and listen to the guest musicians so far here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

You’re so right, it’s indeed the mighty Michael Eriksen of the great Circus Maximus! Cool voice huh? So great to finally work with him, and we had so much fun :-) The winner is Sarah Miranda, please send me a personal message here. Stay tuned for more, and listen to the guest musicians so far here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Michael Eriksen sings on the new Ayreon album

That's right, it’s my favorite rival Tobias Sammet of Avantasia and Edguy. And what an amazing job he did! I’m thrilled to have finally found the perfect role for him on an Ayreon album. The winner is Mike Sarlo, please send me a personal message here. More musicians to guess next week! Listen to the guest musicians so far here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

Yes indeed, this is the amazing Guthrie Govan (The Aristocrats, Steven Wilson)! Lori and I got tears in our eyes when we heard it for the first time... He’s undoubtedly one of the hottest guitar players in the world at the moment, and I’m honored to have him on my album! The winner is Mark David Perry, please send me a personal message here. Listen to the previous musicians here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

No doubt about it, it’s indeed the monumental Hansi Kürsch from Blind Guardian! Not only an extremely powerful singer, but also one of the nicest guys I’ve worked with. The winner is Erik Hoffmann, please send me a personal message here. More musicians to guess next week! Follow the PROGress here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

Haha, controversy! But... indeed it’s the amazing Floor Jansen of Nightwish! (Photo by Andrea Beckers) And once again she managed to impress me, this was undoubtedly the best recording session I ever did with her. The winner is Mike Platvoet, please send me a personal message here. Listen to the guest musicians so far here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Floor Jansen sings on the new Ayreon album

Many good guesses, indeed it’s the incredible Paul Gilbert! Undoubtedly one of the most influential guitar players in the world, so you can imagine how honored I am to have him on this album. The winner is Hasan Arsin, please send me a personal message here. Another singer to guess this week! Follow the PROGress here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

Way too easy again, of course it’s the enchanting Simone Simons of the mighty Epica! I’m so glad that this time I could give her a much bigger part than she had on 01011001, she did an amazing job! The winner is Jeremy A Lasda, please send me a message here. More musicians to guess next week! Follow the PROGress here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

Well that was clearly quite easy again, indeed it’s Tommy Rogers of the amazing Between the Buried and Me! I totally love his solo albums as Thomas Giles, and I’m really excited having him on this album. The winner is Cecil Palmer, please send me a message here. Next singer to guess in a few days! Follow the PROGress here: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ Timeline Photos

I know, that was an easy one to start with! Of course it was the amazing James LaBrie. I’m so proud having his warm emotive voice on Ayreon again! The winner is Andreas Berglund, please send me a personal message here. Next week there will be more singers to guess. You can follow the PROGress of the new album here on this special page we made: http://www.arjenlucassen.com/ay8/ James Labrie Timeline Photos

Hoy se cumplen 7 años de la publicación del 7º álbum de estudio de Ayreon, titulado 01011001. (Hiscio)

Uno de sus mejores trabajos, en esta obra conceptual se narra la historia de una raza alienígena tecnológicamente muy avanzada llamada Forever, que vive en el planeta Y (01011001, en binario) y que, habiendo llegado a su límite evolutivo, decide enviar su ADN a a la Tierra mediante un cometa para empezar de nuevo.

Age of Shadows es el tema de apertura del álbum, con las voces de Floor Jansen y Anneke Van Giersbergen, entre otras. Ayreon: Age Of Shadows (Tension Music Video) Again Ayreon. Again Tension. H. P. Lovecraft passed away on March 15th 1937. 

78 years to the day later, ANTHROPIA pays tribute to him and releases "Non-Euclidean Spaces", concept album based on Cthulhu Mythos, featuring Arjen Anthony Lucassen (Ayreon, Star One, The Gentle Storm) and Edu Falaschi (ex-Angra, Almah). Artwork by David Demaret (official).

It is available on all digital platforms, and on Digipak on our site Adarca : http://lc.cx/jCW

Here is the opening track of the album, to give you an idea of the first steps of Randolph Carter's journey. Enjoy!

PS: For our Kickstarter backers : we send the last pre-orders tomorrow, you should receive it soon :)
--------

H.P. Lovecraft s'est éteint le 15 mars 1937.

78 ans plus tard, jour pour jour, Anthropia lui rend hommage et sort "Non-Euclidean Spaces", concept album basé sur le mythe de Cthulhu, avec Arjen Lucassen (Ayreon, Star One, The Gentle Storm) et Edu Falaschi (ex-Angra, Almah). Artwork par David Demaret.

L'album est disponible sur toutes les plateformes numériques et en Digipak sur notre site Adarca : http://lc.cx/jCW

Voici l'opening track de l'album, pour vous donner une idée du début de voyage de Randolph Carter. Bonne écoute!

PS : Pour nos backers de Kickstarter : nous envoyons les dernières précommandes demain, réception très bientôt donc :) ANTHROPIA - Strange Aeons & The Melancholy of R.C. (Non-Euclidean Spaces) ANTHROPIA - Strange Aeons & The Melancholy of R.C. (Non-Euclidean Spaces) Featuring Arjen Anthony Lucassen Band : ANTHROPIA Album : Non-Euclidean Spaces Song...

Here is "Credits", the single of the new ANTHROPIA album "Non-Euclidean Spaces" based on H. P. Lovecraft's writings, featuring Arjen Anthony Lucassen (Ayreon, Star One, The Gentle Storm,…) and Edu Falaschi (ex-Angra, Almah).

It's the only song of the album that get off Cthulhu Mythos a bit, drawing a parallel with cinema to conclude the album : we all have a role to play on Earth, even if it's sometimes about self-sacrifice for the good of mankind, as Randolph Carter experiments in this concept album… It's also the most accessible song of the album, and we hope that you'll appreciate its "in-your-face" and groovy side!

Enjoy and share, thanks!

-----

Voici "Credits", le single du nouvel album d'Anthropia "Non-Euclidean Spaces", basé sur les écrits de Lovecraft, et avec Arjen Lucassen (Ayreon, Star One, The Gentle Storm,…) et Edu Falaschi (ex-Angra, Almah).

C'est le seul titre qui s'éloigne un peu du Mythe de Cthulhu en proposant un parallèle avec le 7ème art pour conclure l'album : Nous avons tous notre rôle à jouer sur cette Terre, même si parfois il s'agit de se sacrifier dans l'ombre pour le bien de l'humanité, à l'image de Randolph Carter dans ce concept album… C'est le morceau le plus accessible de l'album, et on espère que vous apprécierez son côté "groovy" et pêchu !

Preview van nieuwe Ayreon

Daags nadat Ayreon de cover en tracklist onthulde van het nieuwe album The Source, staat ook de eerste song online. Via Spotify is albumopener The Day That The World Breaks Down te beluisteren, maar als je verder leest hebben we hem ook voor je ingesloten. Het nieuwe album is wederom een dubbel-cd geworden, waarop ondermeer James LaBrie, Tobias Sammet, Floor Jansen, Russell Allen, Simone Simons en Hansi Kürsch te horen zijn. Op de bonus-dvd staan videoclips voor de nummers Everybody Dies, Star Of Sara ..... Preview van nieuwe Ayreon | Metalfan.nl

Ayreons nieuwe album

The Source is de titel van het nieuwe, negende Ayreon-album. Op de opvolger voor het ruim drie jaar oude The Theory of Everything zul je, in tegenstelling tot de meeste eerdere albums, juist veel bekende stemmen terughoren. James LaBrie, Simone Simons, Michael Mills, Floor Jansen, Hansi Kürsch, Russell Allen en Tommy Karevik keren namelijk terug. Paul Gilbert, Guthrie Govan en Marcel Coenen leveren gitaarsolo's op het album, terwijl Mark Kelly juist een keyboardsolo heeft ingespeeld. Wanneer The ..... Ayreons nieuwe album | Metalfan.nl

Stream of Passion stopt

Groot nieuws uit het Stream Of Passion kamp: de band gaat er mee stoppen! Na elf jaar en vier studioalbums vinden de dame en heren het tijd voor verandering. Stream Of Passion werd in 2005 opgericht door Arjen Lucassen, nadat hij met zangeres Marcela Bovio had samengewerkt op het Ayreon-album The Human Equation. Kalender: Tom S. Englund (Evergrey)

Vandaag (maandag 14 december) viert Tom S. Englund zijn 42ste verjaardag. De Zweed is vooral bekend als zanger/gitarist van de progmetalband Evergrey. Daarnaast leverde de vocalist onder meer een gastbijdrage aan het Ayreon-album 01011001 en diverse cd's van Nightrage. Ter ere van Tom Englunds verjaardag delen we vandaag de door hem geschreven Evergrey-track A Touch Of Blessing uit 2004. Evergrey-"A Touch of Blessing" This is a video from the melodic metal band Evergrey. Most of my videos are death metal but this one I decided to put up to show what else I am into. Enjoy!

Kalender: Joost van den Broek (ex-After Forever)

Vandaag viert Joost van den Broek, docent aan het Conservatorium van Amsterdam, zijn 33ste verjaardag. Ondanks zijn jonge leeftijd is de kans groot dat je een of meer albums in de kast hebt staan waarbij de naam van Van den Broek bij de credits vermeld staat. Het bekendst is hij onder metalfans als de voormalige toetsenist en co-songwriter van After Forever. Verder werkte Joost als toetsenist, orkestleider, engineer of producent mee aan albums van onder meer Ayreon, Cirrha Niva, Epica, HDK, MaYaN, Nemesea, PYRAMAZE, ReVamp, Star One, Stream of Passion, Sun Caged, The Gentle Storm en Xandria. Een indrukwekkend rijtje en we zijn benieuwd wat daar allemaal nog bij gaat komen. Ter ere van Van den Broeks verjaardag delen we vandaag de videoclip van Energize Me, een van de bekendste songs die hij schreef en opnam met After Forever. Van harte proficiat, Joost van den Broek!

A big thanks to everyone who came to see Anneke and me on our acoustic tour! It was truly an emotional roller coaster ride for this hermit. The 11 shows went very well and lots of venues were actually sold out, the audiences were absolutely fantastic and gave us the warmest welcome we could wish for. The chemistry between Anneke, me and the crowd felt just perfect. However ... I’m afraid this doesn't necessarily mean I’m going to take up touring again. I’m not sure yet if the advantages (seeing the crowd’s happy faces, meeting them and of course the playing) outweigh the disadvantages (travelling, lack of sleep, endless waiting, back pain and anxiety). I must say that Anneke definitely pulled me through this, she’s so positive and optimistic and a true professional! And of course the enthusiastic reactions of the audiences helped too, I’m truly honored and moved. In the end I’m glad I did it, and am actually kinda proud of myself :-) I hope you will all enjoy The Gentle Storm album and the upcoming shows! Timeline Photos

“The Gentle Storm” concept album will be a double CD, with the same songs on each CD but in VERY different, contrasting arrangements. CD1, the “Gentle”album, will be all acoustic and folky with lots of exotic instruments. CD2, the “Storm”album, will be an all-out, bombastic orchestral metal album. Of course there are plenty of progressive elements mixed in as well. Questions? Ask away! Timeline Photos

It's time for an episode! This week, there's a lot on Noyan and Eden's plate, with new music and music byproducts from Oddland (!), Orphaned Land, Mephistopheles (!), Jimmy Pitts and Equipoise, Imperium Dekadenz official, Drudkh (Official), INQUISITION Official, Periphery, Gojira (just a clip), Hadal Maw, Iron Maiden, Exotype and Ayreon. 

Then, the two discuss the split between Obscura and Fountainhead and its continuing echoes, a fascinating article about natural language analysis and metal, Insomnium cancelling a show in Turkey and the recent trend of sexual assaults in metal festivals.

Finally, the two dive deep into the complicated and divisive discography of none other than In Flames, a once great metal band which is...not so great nowadays. Regardless, their role in the history of metal is undisputed and some of their albums are absolute masterpieces.

As always, thank you so much for listening! We appreciate you all very much.

I was just informed that the 2nd Star One album 'Victims of the Modern Age' is now also available on vinyl! Heavy stuff :-)

https://www.facebook.com/BlooodMusic/photos/a.797206370336692.1073741945.165101886880480/797679246956071 Blood Music Blood Music is extremely pleased once again to present to its roster, the cosmic creations of Arjen Anthony Lucassen's Star One!

We will also be presenting the band's brilliant sophomore album "Victims of the Modern Age" on vinyl for the first time in history, utilizing the double-album limited edition version!

8 years after the smash debut of "Space Metal," Arjen (Ayreon) erupted unexpectedly with yet another beautifully epic sci-fi work, creating even deeper and darker sounds on "Victims," while utilizing the same Star One team as the debut - guest vocalists Dan Swanö (Edge of Sanity), Russell Allen(Symphony X), Floor Jansen (ReVamp) and more!

The album will see its first publication on wax through us in 2015.

Listen here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3iw5up7xtbo

Yessss... Star One is finally available on vinyl!

https://www.facebook.com/BlooodMusic/photos/a.797206370336692.1073741945.165101886880480/797206373670025 Blood Music Blood Music is extremely proud to present to its roster, the epic stylings of Arjen Anthony Lucassen's Star One!

We will be presenting the band's excellent debut album "Space Metal" on vinyl for the first time in history, utilizing the double-album limited edition version!

Based on a concept that was initially developed by the Ayreon frontman and Bruce Dickinson of Iron Maiden, Bruce ultimately left the project.  Mr. Lucassen forged on, bringing on loads of guest vocalists to complete the epic sci-fi work.  Vocalists include Dan Swanö (Edge of Sanity), Russell Allen (Symphony X), Floor Jansen (ReVamp) and more!

This is brand new territory for us, and we're excited to venture into the world of epic metal with one of the absolute kings of the genre.

The album will see its first publication on wax through us in 2015.

Hey guys, stoked to let you know that I'll be playing Devin Townsend and Mike Baker's parts in the stage production of the Ayreon album "The Human Equation"

"The Theater Equation" will run for 4 very special performances in Rotterdam in September, and features James LaBrie from Dream Theater, Anneke van Giersbergen, Heather Findlay, lots and lots of amazing talent. 
The characters "Rage" (originally Devin Townsend on the album), and "Father" (originally the late, great Mike Baker from Shadow Gallery) will be combined into one part. This is the second "Father" role in the Ayreon canon for me!!

3 of the 4 shows are sold out, you can still get tickets for the last show here if you're lucky!

As I told you last week, my former manager Yvette is working on a theater production of The Human Equation with many original vocalists called @The Theater Equation. The ‘Epic Rock Choir’ supports these vocalists on stage. If you want to join this choir, you can audition for it. They will rehearse once a month in Dordrecht, the Netherlands, so you have to live close enough to attend. For full details, check the website: www.epicrockchoir.com or www.thetheaterequation.com Timeline Photos

As you may have already heard, my former manager Yvette Boertje is adapting The Human Equation for the theater! There will be three shows in September 2015 in the Netherlands, featuring many musicians of the original cast. I won’t be performing myself (being a recluse and all), but I am involved in this behind the scenes as an advisor. Check www.facebook.com/thetheaterequation  or www.thetheaterequation.com  for more information, hope to see you there! Timeline Photos
Be sure to check out The Theater Equation, a project that brings The Human Equation to the theater next year -- http://www.thetheaterequation.com
